name: ONE Dine at One World Observatory
address: 117 West St, New York, NY 10007, USA

reviews.text: great experience from moment walking in had a few shows showing the history of the building which was cool, had the dining experience for two with view food was good no complaints friendly staff drinks on point

Eine UnverschÃ¤mtheit zu diesem Preis! Einzig der Blick ist toll, das Essen ist mittelmÃ¤ÃŸig, das Mobilar in die Jahre gekommen, AtmosphÃ¤re einer Bahnhofsvorhalle und laut. Nie wieder und nicht zu empfehlen!

Great place for light fare and wine; even though the menu clearly indicates 18% is added, it would have been helpful to be reminded but wait staff ended up getting 40% tip. They were a bit slow but attentive when able to grab their attention. It was worth the view. Pita was served warm and the truffle fries lived up to the expectation. Chicken was ok. Wine nice and chilled but not very large pours. Wine and apps ended up costing close to $200. Still worth it.

During our visit to One World Observatory, we stopped for lunch and really enjoyed it. Most of the dishes were good  the kids meal wasnâ€™t our favorite, but the incredible view and the friendly staff made the experience worth it.

Went up to the observatory for the views, and came across this place. The staff was very kind, at first they sat me second row (to the view) but after a reservation cancelled they moved me closer to the windows so I could enjoy the view better. The Spinach Lasagna was so good, the sauce was incredible, highly recommend this if you are dining here!

ONE Dine at One World Observatory â€“ Review:

ONE Dine offers a dining experience with unbeatable panoramic views from atop One World Trade Center. The setting is sleek and upscale, perfect for special occasions. The menu features elevated American cuisineâ€”think seared scallops, steaks, and creative cocktails. While the food is good, the real star is the ambiance. Prices are on the higher end, reflecting the location. Reservations are recommended, especially around sunset for a stunning skyline backdrop. Ideal for a memorable NewÂ YorkÂ evening.

Make a reservation if you want a window seat. We did not have one. Itâ€™s still a great view from the non-reservation tables, but I wish I had known! Now you will know. Food was fantastic! Kids had a burger and Mac and cheese and loved them. Great end to our day visiting the observation deck to have a late lunch after visiting and before we headed to the memorial.  We were dressed in polos and tennis shoes and while I wish we had been dressier there were people of all forms of dress from fancier to business casual to like us in shorts and tennis shoes.
We had the chicken, filet mignon, a variety of appetizers and desserts â€” everything was absolutely delicious! Great flavors and perfect presentation. Highly recommend this place!
Good burgers great atmosphere.

This is my third time back. The food is good. Worth the price and view. The fries are great.

One thing to note is that the menu changed from last year. I miss the pork belly from last year. That was good.

One complaint is that kids meals no longer include a free juice, which was disappointing.

The atmosphere was a pleasant surprise! Such a fun local vibe. Nicole, a bartender, makes an amazing dirty martini and makes for a fun and laid back experience in a beautiful location. Highly recommend spending some time here.

If visiting One World Observatory, do not bother with upgrading to the VIP dinner experience.  We did that and experienced nothing VIP about our dinner.  They did not have a table reserved for us so we were given a table in their very loud bar. Our view of Manhattan was instructed by a massive pillar. The sub par food was a disappointment compared to the many other great restaurants we enjoyed in New York. All of this is fine if you may be showing up for a quick drink after a tour. But the expensive VIP dinner is definitely not worth it. Enjoy the tower but fine dining will definitely not be spotted within the view from the top.
Service was unlike anything I've experienced. Very proactive on drinks and repores. Food was excellent.

We went to One Dine last night and our server was Nicole, she was absolutely fabulous and all her recommendations were spot on! My husband had the Ribeye and they kindly remade it when it was too cooked. I got the linguine with pork belly and it was mouthwateringly delicious! I also really enjoyed the smoked trout flatbread, very fresh and light! We went right before sunset and it was amazing to see the city at such heights during the day and at night!!

Dining at ONE World Trade Center is an unforgettable experience, elevated not only by its stunning views but also by the exceptional service provided by staff like Haque M. From the moment guests arrive, Haque creates an atmosphere of warmth and comfort, making even first-time visitors feel at home. His attention to detail is evident in the way he anticipates guestsâ€™ needs before they even ask. Rather than simply providing service, Haque curates an experience that feels both personal and refined. Guests often remark that his hospitality transforms a meal into a memorable occasion. His professionalism is balanced by a genuine friendliness, creating the perfect blend of elegance and ease. In such a grand setting, Haqueâ€™s welcoming presence reminds diners that true hospitality lies in human connection. Thanks to his efforts, dining at ONE becomes more than just a mealâ€”it becomes a lasting memory.

Haque by far is the best server in this establishment and he stands as a testament to friendliness and service! This man is extremely nice and deserves every bit of good coming his way! Next time you come ask for Haque!
Food was really good, but on the expensive side, the atmosphere wasn't great and was super loud. Service was streched thin and slow.
Beware: the reservations are very expensive, non refundable, and donâ€™t warn you that you then need to pay $50 a person to just get to the restaurant

Excelente restaurante.
AlÃ©m da vista deslumbrante, hÃ¡ Ã³timas opÃ§Ãµes de pratos e bebidas.
Os pratos sÃ£o realmente muito saborosos.
Fui de Linguine & Smoked Pork Belly e estava simplesmente perfeito!
Com certeza o prato mais saboroso que provei em NY.
O atendimento Ã© Ok, mas poderia ser bem melhor.

Our group enjoyed some cocktails and appetizers at ONE Dine.   The cocktails were very tasty and well prepared. The appetizers that we had included hummus and warm olives. The food was simply scrumptious. There was plenty for our group of four, and we even had some leftovers. When visiting the freedom Tower again, we will plan to have dinner at ONE Dine so we can sample some more of their tasty treats.  Haque M was our server and he is perfection. He took our orders in a timely manner, and checked in on this frequently, but was not intrusive. Anything we needed, he made sure we had.  As we were preparing to take a selfie of our group, he hurried over and asked to take the photo for us. He took the photo from several angles, ensuring the perfect shot with the best background in the City.  This man is an outstanding server and a great ambassador for ONE Dine!  Thank you so much for the great service, Haque we look forward to seeing you in the future!
Food were amazing, attentive staff and beautiful view. What more can you ask for?

I recently had the pleasure of dining at ONE Dine at One World Observatory, and it was truly an unforgettable experience. Located at the top of One World Trade Center, the views alone are worth the visit. You get a 360-degree panoramic view of the New York City skyline, which is absolutely breathtaking, especially as the sun sets over the Hudson River.

The food was just as impressive as the view. I started with the lobster bisque, which was rich and creamy with just the right amount of seasoning. For the main course, I had the dry-aged New York strip steak â€“ it was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth with every bite. The service was impeccable, with our server being friendly, professional, and always ready with recommendations.

The ambiance of the restaurant itself is elegant yet comfortable, with modern decor and large windows that allow you to take in the stunning sights of the city as you dine. Itâ€™s clear that every detail, from the food to the service, has been carefully curated to create an exceptional experience.

If youâ€™re visiting New York and want a truly memorable dining experience, I would highly recommend ONE Dine. Itâ€™s the perfect place for a special occasion or just to treat yourself to an incredible evening with an unparalleled view.

poor service
there is plenty of empty table yet still seat us in booth

The food was fantastic, the staff friendly & accomodating, superb service, very attentive, fantastic atmosphereâ€¦out of this world experience, amazing view.
If I could give this place more than five stars I would and of course the bartender was also fantastic in making drinks.  I had a mojito that taste amazing.   I definitely recommend this restaurant
On the pricey side. The views are incredible though, especially when the sun sets.

Bartenders Jonathan and Matthew made this absolutely AMAZING as a spot for a birthday celebration. The drinks were also TOP SHELF and delish, and we had a fab experience all around. AMAZING views, and wonderful celebration experience!
All par excellence

I wasnt aware you had pay $ 54 each for party of 5 guest total of $270 just to enter !  After getting screwed we had jump thru hoops to get to restaurant every one thought we were  with a tour  group. Service slow , bread served ok , Filet was good and View was Nice. Was it worth bill $ 400 plus entry fee $270 total of $670 NO WAY - ONE AND DONE !

Had an amazing lunch experience with a fantastic view. The food was exceptional. I especially loved the sticky toffee pudding for dessert. Our server was friendly and attentive. We booked the lunch package for $80 (plus taxes and gratuity). It includes an appetizer, entree and drink plus entry to the observatory.

Dining at One Dine was an unforgettable experience from start to finish. The moment I arrived, I was impressed by the warm hospitality and attention to detail from the staff. The atmosphere strikes the perfect balance between elegant and inviting, making it ideal for a special occasion or simply an elevated night out.

Service was impeccable. The staff were attentive without being intrusive, knowledgeable about the menu, and eager to make thoughtful recommendations. Neisha our server was amazing! As well as the supervisor, Matthew who I felt genuinely took care of our party throughout our entire experience to make sure we felt prioritized from start to finish!

To top it off, the views from the restaurant added an extra touch of magic. Itâ€™s rare to find a place where the food, service, and ambiance all come together so seamlessly.

If youâ€™re looking for a restaurant that delivers not just a meal, but a complete dining experience, One Dine is absolutely worth it. I canâ€™t wait to return.

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

A wonderful dinner with a striking view! We were seated with a view of uptown Manhattan. I felt that, despite the size of the restaurant, it felt very intimate and humble. Most tables are oriented towards a view, and the restaurant is on the 101st floor (above the 100th floor observatory). We ended up spending about $160 for two. Keep in mind drinks are quite pricey and there is a mandatory gratuity of 18 percent added to each check.

One disappointment is that you need to purchase tickets to the observatory to even access the restaurant. Had the food at the restaurant be cheaper, this wouldn't be a complaint. However, given the nearly $100 price tag for two observatory tickets plus the cost of the food, I walked away spending nearly $265 for dinner. Nonetheless, this is an iconic building with a view unlike any other in New York City. It is worth the visit and price!
Great service provided by Rahman.  Very pleasant server

I had the absolute pleasure of dining at One Dine for my birthday, and it was truly an unforgettable experience thanks to the incredible service from the staff. Haque, our server, went above and beyond to make the night feel specialâ€”he was attentive, kind, and genuinely cared about making sure everything was perfect from start to finish.

And a huge shoutout to Matthew, the bartender, whose attention to detail and skill behind the bar did not go unnoticed. Every drink he crafted was top-tier, and his warm personality made the experience even better.

Between the breathtaking views, delicious food, and outstanding service, One Dine made my birthday feel extra special. Highly recommend!

I went there with my wife for our anniversary Nixon Set us up with a table by the window for an experience with amazing views
The sunset was unbelievable, and the food was excellent
Our server, Nicole took great Care of us everything from beginning to end was Five Star
Everything very nice

We got a reservation for 730, so we got to watch the sun set with a gorgeous view of New York City lighting up for the night. Our server, Stephanie, was amazing, laughing and chatting with us. The food was amazing, and the staff was very careful to ask about food restrictions as we were ordering.
There are not many dishes to choose from. It was no non-alcoholic beer but it was in menu thou... They don' accept cash.

I came here on a rainy day but I still had a wonderful time. Matthew at the bar had us cracking up with some hysterical stories and Jason made us delicious drinks. Matthew really made our experience special and the weather cleared up after all. I would highly recommend.

Breathtaking views and exceptional food. The fish was fresh and perfectly cooked, and the cake was unforgettable. Dining at ONE Dine while overlooking Manhattan is a one-of-a-kind experience. Highly recommended!
æœ€é«˜â€œå±¤â€çš„äº«å—å•¦ğŸ˜†

Bonjour, je tiens simplement Ã  souligner que le restaurant applique automatiquement et de faÃ§on OBLIGATOIRE 18% de "gratuity" ce qui correspond Ã  un pourboire pour le service OBLIGATOIRE de 18% la ou la majoritÃ© des restaurants new yorkais vous PROPOSE/CONSEIL un minimale de 8% de tips/gratuity.
Certe il s'agit du ONE WOLRD mais tout de mÃªme...
Donc pour notre cas, deux plats pour un totale de 68$ qui nous reviennent au final Ã  80$.

My husband made a reservation for my birthday
Needless to say we were running late and please just keep in mind that they only see people until 730. We made it by 739 and I would like to give a major shout out to Denilsa who went above and beyond to make sure I got up to my reservation, thank you to the host for speaking to the chef who made an exception all of you made my birthday special. As for food we had the fillet mignon, Mac & cheese and mashed potatoes and the lava cake. My husband and daughter definitely enjoyed thank you !
Excelente services and the best views, of course

Wow wow wow! We did the dinner and experience and it was worth every penny. Got the hummus as a appetizer the filet medium rare, which was so flavorful and the lava desert.  My friend got the coffee bread pudding.  It was to die for. The mashed potatoes were amazing!! The bourbon Manhattan was filled to the top. I'm telling ya do the dinner and experience all together!!! You're welcome.

Beautiful view but terrible service, Server was so unhappy to be there, lots of eye rolling, doesnâ€™t have to provide good service when 18% gratuity is already on bill. Food is subpar for the price, lobster was chewy and had pieces of shell in it. Much better dining near by.

Food
Service
Atmosphere all good

Big big big issue is that if you book a standard reservation, they make you buy a $60 per person observatory ticket. They only inform you about this by email after you already provided your credit card information stopping you from canceling the reservation. See attached.

Doesnâ€™t get better than this.
Very special place for food and drinks.
Top of the line service.
delicious food
Great drinks
Mathew at the bar is great!
A+
Terrible restaurantâ€¦. The interior is from 2001, the view is only pretty from certain tables and they donâ€™t tell you itâ€™s going to be like that. Food sucks
Amazing views, Matthew at the bar was so friendly making sure everyone was taken care of. A++ service the cocktails were very well made! We will be back!

The Observatory/VIP tour was excellent, but the restaurant experience at One Dine was a complete disappointment. Despite arriving 20 minutes early and politely requesting a window seat, we were abruptly cut off and spoken over by Tracy, who was rude, unprofessional, and clearly had an attitude. Her behavior set the tone for what became an even worse experience with our server, Andrea Lee, who barely spoke, took our order, and then vanished. The service was indifferent at best and downright disrespectful at worst. On top of that, the menu changes every few months, so donâ€™t expect to get what you see on Yelp or OpenTable. Our options were limited and underwhelming. Save your moneyâ€”do the observatory tour and eat somewhere else.

Para continuar con la celebraciÃ³n de cumpleaÃ±os, mi esposo hizo reservaciÃ³n en este maravilloso lugar, con una vista que te deja sin aliento, es simplemente hermosa.

Considera que lo mejor es reservar y llegar con suficiente tiempo, (lo mismo si vas en automÃ³vil, reserva un espacio en alguno de los estacionamientos del Ã¡rea). Una vez que llegas y subes al piso en donde se encuentra One Dine, empieza a relajarte porque lo que viene es una serie de platillos bastante golosos.

La comida es buena, se siente fresca y bien  cocinada. El servicio es de lo mejor, estÃ¡ claro que saben que si vienes a celebrar algo, ellos darÃ¡n el mejor de los esfuerzos para hacerte sentir cÃ³modo y disfrutando al mÃ¡ximo la experiencia.

El ambiente es sofisticado y moderno, si no tienes reservaciÃ³n, quedarte en el bar siempre es una buena opciÃ³n.

Y como escribÃ­ en un inicio, la vista hace que magia y crea una atmÃ³sfera inigualable para disfrutar con personas especiales. AdemÃ¡s, puedes vivir  la experiencia de estar en uno de los observatorios mÃ¡s increÃ­bles de Manhattan.

Â¡Experiencia ganadora!

Great atmosphere! It truly is amazing to sit by the window and look over NYC. Drinks are good, they try to decorate them and make look fancy, but itâ€™s not really working well. I didnâ€™t order any of their food, but I hope the presentation is better than what I got on my charcuterie board. Wish it was presented better as you eat with your eyes first. Some grapes were also bad. Overall atmosphere is worth it, drinks are decent, but overpriced.. would come back for drinks again, too bad you have to buy a ticket to get up there!

Worth dining if you are going up to view the city. Food had lots of flavor.  The people were very nice and helpful.  The area was very clean and offered more views of the city.
Also the bathrooms are very clean.

Itâ€™s ok but far from outstanding or worth the prices.  You pay for the experience basically of dining at the top of the World Trade Center.

Mandatory gratuity is a HUGE no-no for me.  Hit for 18% without a choice.  Btw, Iâ€™m a generous tipper that almost always leaves 25-35% so on my bill you cost your server.

We recently dined at the restaurant atop One World Observatory Tower for my wife's birthday celebration, and it was an unforgettable experience. The sea bass special was a standoutâ€”so tender and crisp, served with a wonderful sauce that elevated the whole dish. The appetizers, particularly the burrata, were bursting with flavor. The atmosphere was equally impressive with breathtaking views that made the evening even more special. To wrap up, the desserts and cocktails (particularly the Old Fashioned) were spot on. The service was great, Rahman was our waiter. He was on top of everything. This place is a must-visit for anyone looking for a memorable dining experience with top-notch food and views.

Total Score: 4.45

Bathroom: 4.75/5
Bathroom has very nice view and color theme. Simple but effective. Only complaint is toilet too tall :((

Customer Service: 4/5
Frequently checking in on us and refilled waters. Waitress was giving â€œqueen never cry.â€

Ambiance: 4.25/5
Very moody lighting and somewhat nice view of the building skyline. I know itâ€™s a skyscraper but tbh there were too many pillars blocking the view

Food: 2/5
Honestly most of the food was okay. They served like â€œfancy foodâ€ but lots of the food had burnt bits, and lots of the food was lacking in like flavor. Would like some sauce or seasoning or something. Also the beef was raw so I ended pooping right then and there ğŸ«£. Thankfully the bathrooms were nice.

Wow: -1/1
Raw food :(

Total Score = BR + CS + 2*AM + 5*FOOD + WOW

One Dine at the One World Observatory is a restaurant that pleasantly surprised me with its pricing, especially when compared to other tower restaurants in Asia. Although itâ€™s not cheap, at around $70 per person, itâ€™s relatively reasonable for the experience you get. It's essential to make a reservation in advance, and note that you also need to purchase elevator tickets to access the restaurantâ€”having just a reservation won't suffice.

The view from One Dine is absolutely stunning, particularly at night. I highly recommend going for dinner rather than lunch to fully appreciate the amazing atmosphere after dark. However, while the ambiance and view are top-notch, the food itself is quite mid-quality. It's a decent dining experience, but don't expect gourmet cuisine.

Overall, One Dine offers a memorable experience thanks to its breathtaking views and evening ambiance, making it worth a visit despite the average food quality. If you're planning to go, make sure to look at the pictures and reserve your spot well in advance.

The observatory is really really good, but compared to some of the other ones I will only give it 4 stars
I got a coffee and a croissant and that was pretty good with the views on top of it. The story was complete.
Highly recommend just to spend a little more time up there and enjoy the view

Nikki was an excellent waitress very helpful and so nice. The views are spectacular. The food was absolutely fabulous. We also had the specialty cocktails and they were very good. Good value and great experience. Thank you Nikki!

We did the lunch experience and it was all wonderful. The food was rich and great portions. The drinks were heavy pours and delicious. For the money - the views and experience was phenomenal. Service was excellent. I would recommend getting your tickets at least 30 mins prior so you can enjoy some of the things leading up to lunch. For a "tourist" spot this was hands down one of the best overall things in all my travels and doing touristy things.

I went here this past Sunday. Everything was amazing, the whole experience. The restaurant is on the 101st floor and I highly suggest you make your reservations around Sunset time if you want a beautiful picture. I got the charcuterie board a small plate and the steak and fries for the main and I got three vegan chocolate chip cookies and it came with ice cream which was amazing. The view from where we sat was incredible/breathtaking!

We booked the Premium View Dining Experience, which came out at just under $500 for two after taxes and their compulsory 18% gratuity.

We went early so that we could look around the Observatory. The views from there are stunning.

The two drinks included in the package are limited to $23 each in value which gets you most drinks except premium wines and spirits. The food was very good. We had burratta (very good) and pork belly (too much fat) to start, followed by steak frites for a main course, which was excellent and perfectly cooked. The deserts were OK.

The ambience left a lot to be desired. There was party of about 14 there who were very noisy (one had even brought a yapping dog) and we were overlooking the Observatory deck, which added to the noise. In addition, there seemed to be some people there just having a drink or a bar snack and on two occasions people paused immediately next to our table to look at the view and take photos while standing over us. The staff were nice but the service was slow.

It wasn't a particularly relaxing dining experience and we weren't right next to a window so I think diners with the basic package were no worse off than us. We've eaten in similar restaurants (The Shard in London, CN Tower in Toronto, Sky Tower in Auckland) and all those place offered a genuine, relaxing restaurant experience with tables that gave diners a better view of the outside.

My advice would be to pay for  the basic Observatory ticket and eat elsewhere.

It's a place where you're paying first for the excellent views of the NYC and secondly for food.
Restaurant accessible only if you have a ticket to One World Observatory so counting the price for tickets - make reservation with dining package.
If you're visiting just as part of One Deck Visit, be ready for a wait to be seated unless you're planning for a bar.
Cocktail prices are about $23-25.

The view was amazing! Not sure if itâ€™s worth almost $250 per person after taxes. When you go here the view is what you are paying for. The food was decent, change the location and it would not have been worth the price at all. The quality of the tables the space and the loudness it doesnâ€™t match the expectations that comes with the priceâ€¦The steak was not super hot and seemed like it had been sitting in the kitchen awhile before brining it out. I found a piece of paper in my dessert. The staff in restaurants was very nice, but when we went down to the observatory deck the staff was rude and unprofessional. If youâ€™re going to complain about your job and the guestsâ€¦wait until no one is around.

The food was amazing with a good different taste. The steak was amazing along the fries and it was so filling. Frank and Rahman took amazing care of us and we appreciate then kindly alongside the view that they gave us to celebrate my girlfriends birthday. Thank you Rahman for the great pictures as well, they are great memories

Took my wife here for our 17th year anniversary. The food was more then enough and the drinks were strong. The server Hack was an outstanding gentleman and should definitely be recognized for his hospitality. The only takeaway is the way the restaurant is kind of open with the observation piece with can create noise pollution from other people when dining. Also maybe if the dining area had a little bit of music that probably couldâ€™ve canceled that out.

We celebrated our 6 year anniversary and One Dine did not disappoint. We highly recommend coming here for any special occasion.

We did the all inclusive dining experience with window seating.

HIGHLIGHTS:
- Views were perfect at sunset and a great transition to night lights

- Food was absolutely delicious from start to end and they give generous portions. You will most likely take food home!

- Staff were truly sweet and so accommodating. Special shout out to Frank who took care of us the whole night and to Josephine who gave us an amazing and special experience in the observatory

THINGS TO KNOW:
- Dress attire - most people are casual so the â€œupscaleâ€ feel isnâ€™t there initially but as time passes you kinda forget that.

- Noise level - if you want a more intimate dinner experience, I recommend you schedule your time for later in the evening to limit the noise from the observatory guests.

- Window seat table - itâ€™s nice but I wouldnâ€™t say itâ€™s all that great because you are still kinda far from the glass and since the observatory ticket lets you get closer I donâ€™t think the window seat is all that special. It would be better if the seating was right up against the actual glass.

- Decor lacks a luxury or slightly elevated feel. Itâ€™s not all that impressive when you arrive. I honestly thought it was part of the cafe. I recommend you sit towards the back of the dining area.

Beautiful views, as expected, on the top of WTC. Cocktails were pricey at $23, but again, as expected. I enjoyed the Uptown Martini more than my partnerâ€™s New World Fashion.

We sat by the bar as we came here after work and didnâ€™t think to make a reservation for a table by the windows. Nonetheless, we were able to capture the beautiful sunset views from the bar.

Service was average, and we had to remind the bartender for some water - this is NYC, you get a glass of New York's finest as soon as you are seated.

I would like to thank Niki for going above and beyond to ensure that our dinner experience was awesome. Their sincere welcome and excellent service made all the difference.

Thank you Josephine

This restaurant offers a beautiful view of the city, creating a lovely atmosphere to unwind. While the drink menu has a decent selection, Iâ€™d recommend customizing your own, or ask for a drink you are used to (your go to), as the options provided didn't quite hit the mark for me.

The hostess was warm and welcoming, setting a great first impression. However, once seated, the service felt somewhat disconnected, as different staff members handled seating and table service.

For an all-inclusive experience, I expected something truly special for my family, but unfortunately, it fell short. We were hoping for a memorable evening, one that made us feel appreciated and wowed, but even my children walked away disappointed. It is not kids friendly and would recommend a local restaurant, a place that sells pizza or other foods to quench the need for a descent food. Zaza is one of the great restaurants that comes to mind. Having had the pleasure of eating exemplary dishes in Europe, and the observatory depicting the countries that have visited it, their menu fails to bring in great dishes or tastes, minus a few sides.
Take advantage of browsing the menu to see if you want to pay for such meals prior to committing.
The pictures proudly posted online as you search for restaurants to dine in may have been as such a while back, but not the as current as their presented menu.
Expect the automatic/default 18% gratuity to your check, no matter the size or order.
Ambiente increÃ­ble y vistas sin igual. Ideal para pasar una velada sin precedentes. Barato no es, pero el sitio es privilegiado.

I recently had the privilege of dining at an observatory restaurant in the heart of Manhattan that exceeded all my expectations. The breathtaking panoramic views of the city's skyline coupled with impeccable service made for an unforgettable experience. However, it was the exceptional drinks that truly stole the show. The Old Fashioned cocktail, expertly crafted with precision and a perfect balance of flavors, was a sheer delight. Sipping on this timeless classic while taking in the mesmerizing views was a true highlight of the evening. As for the food, the oysters were incredibly fresh and served with a variety of delectable accompaniments that enhanced their natural brininess. The shrimp pasta, with its perfectly al dente noodles and succulent shrimp, was a symphony of flavors that transported me to coastal culinary paradise. This observatory restaurant proves that it's not just the breathtaking vistas, but also the exceptional drinks and superb food, that make it an absolute must-visit destination for both locals and tourists alike.

One Dine, perched atop the iconic skyscraper, the breathtaking panoramic views of the city are matched only by the exquisite dining experience. The modern and elegant ambiance sets the stage for a memorable meal. The menu, a fusion of sophistication and diverse flavors, caters to discerning palates. Attentive service enhances the overall dining experience. Whether enjoying brunch, lunch, or dinner, One Dine offers not just a meal but an elevated journey for those seeking a refined culinary adventure amidst the awe-inspiring backdrop of the World Trade Center. Truly a must-visit for those desiring a unique and upscale dining experience in the heart of Manhattan.

After enjoying the gorgeous evening view of Manhattan, me and my friend decided to dine here and it was one of the best decision ever!
The food was great, the staff is super nice. Especially Nicky whoâ€™s very attentive and always has a beautiful smile on her face. Thank you for making our experience extra special :)

I am Not sure what the people that gave this place a bad review were smoking but our experience was stellar. From the views, to the food and the servers and host, everything was phenomenal.

The server and assistant server Kenyell and Rahman were speedy, efficient and caring. They took 15+ pictures of my wife and I for her birthday and had smiles and positive energy galore. We will definitely come back.

The food was tasty and done to perfection and the drink menu plentiful.

A total 10/10!!
